meanings.definition: Characterized by or resembling a squall.
meanings.sent1: The stormy weather outside had a squallish feel to it.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds and strong winds made the day seem squallish.
meanings.sent3: The squallish wind blew my hat off my head!
meanings.sent4: Her temper was as squallish as the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind was so squallish, it felt like nature was angry.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a squall.
meanings.sent1: The sudden burst of rain was quite squallish in nature.
meanings.sent2: The ship struggled to stay afloat in the squallish sea.
meanings.sent3: The squallish downpour caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: His mood turned squallish as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent5: The squallish conditions made it difficult to see more than a few feet ahead.

meanings.sent1: The baby's squallish cries could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The squallish child finally fell asleep after being comforted.
meanings.sent3: The squallish puppy demanded attention with its loud barks.
meanings.sent4: Her squallish outburst surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The squallish nature of the toddler's tantrum left the parents exhausted.
